name: John deBary’s Singapore Sling
instructions:
1. In a shaker, combine the drink ingredients. Add ice and shake for 15 seconds.
2. Strain into an ice-filled Collins or water glass. Garnish with the pineapple wedge and a cherry speared on a pick. Serve with a straw.


 ## Editors note:

### Grenadine:

Combine equal parts pomegranate juice with granulated sugar in a saucepan, over low heat. Whisk until dissolved. Place in airtight container and keep in refrigerator for up to one week.
description: Made properly, says deBary, the Singapore Sling cocktail recipe should make a drink that's “juicy, fruity and refreshing.”

ingredients.name: Navy Strength Gin
ingredients.description: Navy strength gin is a high-proof gin with an alcohol content of at least 57% ABV, historically associated with the British Royal Navy and known for its robust flavor and ability to ignite gunpowder.

ingredients.name: Pineapple juice
ingredients.description: Pineapple juice is extracted by passing fresh, ripe pineapple through a juice extractor (juicer) or by muddling fresh cut pineapple chunks and then straining out the solids.

ingredients.name: Cherry heering
ingredients.description: Cherry Heering is a Danish cherry-flavored liqueur with a deep red color. It is made from a base of spirits, sugar, and cherries, specifically sour cherries, which contribute to its rich and sweet flavor profile. Cherry Heering is known for its versatility in cocktails and is often used in classic and modern mixology. One of the most famous cocktails featuring Cherry Heering is the Singapore Sling. The liqueur has a distinct cherry taste with hints of almond and spices, making it a popular choice for adding depth and complexity to a variety of drinks.

ingredients.name: Cointreau
ingredients.description: Orange-flavoured triple sec liqueur, it was originally called Curaçao Blanco Triple Sec. Usually more dry tasting than Orange Curaçao.

ingredients.name: Bénédictine
ingredients.description: Herbal liqueur flavored with twenty-seven flowers, berries, herbs, roots, and spices. The liqueur has a complex flavor profile with notes of honey, citrus, herbs, and spices. Bénédictine is often enjoyed as a sipping liqueur and is also used as an ingredient in various cocktails, including classic drinks like the Bénédictine and Brandy. The production of Bénédictine dates back to the 19th century, and the liqueur is known for its unique and distinctive taste.

ingredients.name: Angostura aromatic bitters
ingredients.description:
Angostura bitters is a concentrated bitters (herbal alcoholic preparation) and highly aromatic flavoring agent used in the preparation of cocktails and various culinary applications. It is a dark brown liquid made from a secret blend of herbs and spices, created by the House of Angostura in Trinidad and Tobago. Despite its name, Angostura bitters does not contain angostura bark; instead, it features a proprietary combination of botanical ingredients.

Angostura bitters typically comes in small bottles with a distinctive oversized label and a built-in dasher top, allowing for controlled and precise pouring.

Despite the name, Angostura bitters is non-alcoholic in the sense that it is not consumed in large quantities and is used as a flavoring agent rather than a beverage on its own.

Angostura bitters has become an iconic and essential ingredient in the world of cocktails, appreciated for its ability to elevate and enhance the overall drinking experience.
